intro: Aulomyrcia linguiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. Aulomyrcia linguiformis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
